Detailed Description

Generic interface for kinematics, dynamics, and other manipulator model functions.

The ManipulatorModel class is a generic base class that provides functions related to the modelling of manipulators. Specifically, generic functions are provided for:

  • Forward and inverse kinematics
  • Dynamics
  • Management of manipulator configurations
  • Jacobian functions
  • Mechnical limits (e.g., joint limits)

The class ManipulatorModel only provides a generic interface. The actual implementation is done in a base class (e.g., the class PumaModel).

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: RoboticPlatform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: Manipulator Model Classes
// Authors: Erkan Zergeroglu, Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Wed Nov 29 11:52:29 GMT 2000
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: ManipulatorModel.t.cpp
// Example program for the class ManipulatorModel.
//
// This is a generic test program for the manipulator model classes.
// It works for all manipulator model classes. The program
// generates random joint position vectors, uses then forward
// kinematics and inverse kinematics to see if we get back to the same
// joint vector (including some math error of course).
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "ManipulatorModel.hpp"
#include "WAMModel.hpp"

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main()
{
  WAMModel wamModel;
  int i;

  cout << "Available manipulator models:" << endl;
  cout << "-----------------------------" << endl;
  for (i = 0; i < TypeInfo::getNumTypes(); i++)
    cout << i + 1 << " " << TypeInfo::getTypeByIndex(i)->getClassName() << endl;
  
  cout << endl;
  cout << "Which model do you want to use: ";
  int num;
  cin >> num;
  
  ManipulatorModel *model = (ManipulatorModel *)
    TypeInfo::getTypeByName("ManipulatorModel");
  if (model == 0)
  {
    cout << "Class not found." << endl;
    //return -1;
  }
  
  model = &wamModel;
  VectorBase<> *jointVector = model->allocateJointVector();
  VectorBase<> *jointVector2 = model->allocateJointVector();
  
  cout << "Manipulator Model Class: " << model->getTypeInfo()->getClassName()
       << ", " << model->getNumJoints() << " joints." << endl;
  
  for (int num = 1; num <= 1000; num++)
  {
    cout << "--------------- Test " << num << " ---------------" << endl;
  
    // Create random joint position
    for (i = 1; i <= jointVector->getNumElements(); i++)
    {
      double pos = model->getMinimumJointPosition(i - 1) +
        ((double) rand() / RAND_MAX) *
        (model->getMaximumJointPosition(i - 1) - model->getMinimumJointPosition(i - 1));
        
      jointVector->setElement(i, pos);
    }

    // Print joint position vector
    cout << "q = ";
    for (int i = 1; i <= jointVector->getNumElements(); i++)
      cout << jointVector->getElement(i) << " ";
    cout << endl;
  
    // Forward kinematics
    int config;
    Transform x = model->forwardKinematics(*jointVector, config);
    if (model->d_status.isStatusError())
    {
      cout << model->d_status.getMessageText() << endl;
      return -1;
    }
  
    // Print end-effector transform
    cout << "(x y z) = " << transpose(x.getTranslation()) << endl;
    double r, p, y;
    x.getRollPitchYaw(r, p, y);
    cout << "(r p y) = " << r << " " << p << " " << y << endl;
  
    // Inverse kinematics
    model->inverseKinematics(x, config, *jointVector2);
    if (model->d_status.isStatusError())
    {
      cout << model->d_status.getMessageText() << endl;
      return -1;
    }   
  
    // Print joint position vector
    cout << "q = ";
    for (int i = 1; i <= jointVector2->getNumElements(); i++)
      cout << jointVector2->getElement(i) << " ";
    cout << endl;

    // Calculate error
    double e = 0;
    for (int i = 1; i <= jointVector->getNumElements(); i++)
    {
      double d = jointVector->getElement(i) - jointVector2->getElement(i);
      e += d * d;
    }
  
    cout << "Error: " << e << endl;
    cout << endl;
  }
  
  delete jointVector;
  delete jointVector2;
  
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ManipulatorModel ( const char * objectName = 0 )
 

The constructor performs no action. The class ManipulatorModel contains only functions, there are no data members.

~ManipulatorModel ( ) [virtual]
 

The destructor performs no action.

Member Function Documentation

const TypeInfo * getTypeInfo ( ) const [virtual]
 

Returns the type info of the class.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, and WAMModel.

double getMinimumJointPosition ( int joint ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines the minimum position of a joint.

Parameters:
joint   The joint number (starting at 1).
Returns:
The minimum position of a joint in radians (revolute joint)/meters (prismatic joint).

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

double getMaximumJointPosition ( int joint ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines the maximum position of a joint.

Parameters:
joint   The joint number (starting at 1).
Returns:
The maximum position of a joint in radians (revolute joint)/meters (prismatic joint).

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

VectorBase * allocateJointVector ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Allocates a new vector of type Vector<numJoints>. The vector is allocated with "new" and needs to be freed with "delete".

Returns:
A pointer to the allocated vector.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

MatrixBase * allocateMatrixForJacobian ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Allocates a new matrix of type Matrix<6, numJoints>. This matrix fits exactly the Jacobian matrix. The matrix is allocated with "new" and needs to be freed with "delete".

Note that this function only allocates an empty matrix of the correct size, the jacobian is not initialized (use the functions jacobian() and inverseJacobianTranspose() for this purpose).

Returns:
A pointer to the allocated matrix.

Example: 

     // Generic programming - Get whatever manipulator is specified
     // in the global configuration file
     ObjectManager om;
     Manipulator *manipulator = om.createDerivedObject<Manipulator>();
     ManipulatorModel *model = manipulator->getManipulatorModel();
    
     // Get current position
     VectorBase<> *jointPosition = model->createJointVector();
     manipulator->getCurrentJointPosition(jointPosition);
    
     // Calculate jacobian
     MatrixBase<> *jacobian = model->createJacobianMatrix();
     model->jacobian(jointPosition, jacobian);
    
     // Clean up
     delete manip;
     delete jointPosition;
     delete jacobian;

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

MatrixBase * allocateMatrixForInverseJacobian ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Allocates a new matrix of type Matrix<numJoints, 6>. This matrix fits exactly the inverse or transpose Jacobian matrix. The matrix is allocated with "new" and needs to be freed with "delete".

Note that this function only allocates an empty matrix of the correct size, the jacobian is not initialized (use the functions jacobianInverse() and jacobianTranspose() for this purpose).

Returns:
A pointer to the allocated matrix.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

int getNumJoints ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

Determines the number of joints of the manipulator.

Returns:
The number of joints.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

bool checkVectorSizeForJointPosition ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition )
 

Checks, if a given joint position vector has the correct size for this manipulator (i.e., the vector has as many elements as the manipulator has joints). If the size is not correct, d_status is set to error.

Returns:
true: The vector has the correct size.
false: The vector does not have the correct size.

bool checkMatrixSizeForJacobian ( const MatrixBase<>& matrix )
 

Checks, if a given matrix has the correct size to fit a jacobian or inverse transpose jacobian of this manipulator. If the size is not correct, d_status is set to error.

Returns:
true: The matrix has the correct size.
false: The matrix does not have the correct size.

bool checkMatrixSizeForInverseJacobian ( const MatrixBase<>& matrix )
 

Checks, if a given matrix has the correct size to fit a jacobian transpose or an inverse jacobian of this manipulator. If the size is not correct, d_status is set to error.

Returns:
true: The matrix has the correct size.
false: The matrix does not have the correct size.

int getNumConfigurations ( ) const [pure virtual]
 

Determines the number of configurations that the manipulator has. This value is identical to the number of solutions of the inverse kinematics for a specific end-effector position (Considering a non-redundant robot).

Returns:
The number of configurations.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

const char * getConfigurationName ( int configuration ) const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the name for the configuration (e.g., "wrist up", "wrist down", etc.).

Parameters:
configuration   Index of the configuration.

Example: 

     void listConfigurations(ManipulatorModel *model)
     {
       for (int i = 0; i < model->getNumConfigurations(); i++)
       {
         cout << "Configuration " << i + 1 << ": "
              << model->ConfigurationName(i);
       }
     }

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

bool isForwardKinematicsImplemented ( ) const [virtual]
 

Determines if the function forwardKinematics() is implemented. This class always returns false, because in the class ManipulatorModel, no function is implemented. A derived class must return true if the function is implemented.

Returns:
true: This function is implemented.
false: The function is not implemented.

Example: 

     Puma robot;
     ManipulatorModel *model = robot.getManipulatorModel();
    
     if (model->isForwardKinematicsImplemented())
     {
       Vector<6> jointPosition;
       robot.getCurrentJointPosition(jointPosition);
    
       cout << "End-Effector T6 Transform: " << endl
            << forwardKinematics(jointPosition) << endl;
     }
     else
     {
       cout << "Forward kinematics is not implemented!" << endl;
     }

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

bool isInverseKinematicsImplemented ( ) const [virtual]
 

Determines if the function inverseKinematics() is implemented. This class always returns false, because in the class ManipulatorModel, no function is implemented. A derived class must return true if the function is implemented.

Returns:
true: This function is implemented.
false: The function is not implemented.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

bool isJacobianImplemented ( ) const [virtual]
 

Determines if the functions using the jacobian matrix are implemented (i.e., jacobian() and jacobianTranspose(). This class always returns false, because in the class ManipulatorModel, neither function is implemented. A derived class must return true if the functions are implemented.

Returns:
true: This function is implemented.
false: The function is not implemented.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

bool isInverseJacobianImplemented ( ) const [virtual]
 

Determines if the functions using the inverse jacobian matrix are implemented (i.e., inverseJacobian() and inverseJacobianTranspose(). This class always returns false, because in the class ManipulatorModel, neither function is implemented. A derived class must return true if the functions are implemented.

Returns:
true: This function is implemented.
false: The function is not implemented.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

Returns:
true: This function is implemented.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

Returns:
true: This function is implemented.

Reimplemented in Puma560Model.

Transform forwardKinematics ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
int & configuration ) [virtual]
 

Performs the forward kinematics calculation (Calculates the end-effector transform and configuration from the joint position).

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isForwardKinematicsImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointPosition   A vector containing the position of each joint in radians (revolute joint)/meters (prismatic joint).
configuration   This variable is set to the resulting configuration of the manipulator. Is it possible to omit this parameter.
Returns:
The corresponding 4x4 homogenous transformation calculated using the forward kinematics.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

bool inverseKinematics ( const Transform & endEffectorTransform,
int configuration,
VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
double epsilon = 0.1 ) [virtual]
 

Performs the inverse kinmatics calculation (Calculates the joint position from the end-effector transform and configuration).

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isInverseKinematicsImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
endEffectorTransform   The end-effector position and orientation
configuration   The end-effector configuration.
epsilon   A measure of how close the user wants to get to a singularity.
jointPosition   The calculated joint position vector.
Returns:
false: if the robot is in near to a singularpoint (as much as epsilon)
true: No singularity detected.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

void jacobian ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
MatrixBase<>& jacobian ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the manipulator Jacobian from given the joint position.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isJacobianImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointPosition   The current position of the manipulator.
jacobian   The corresponding Jacobian matrix.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

void jacobianTranspose ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
MatrixBase<>& jacobianTranspose ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the transpose of the Jacobian matrix from given the joint position.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isJacobianImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointPosition   The current position of the manipulator.
jacobianTranspose   The corresponding Jacobian transpose matrix.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

void inverseJacobian ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
MatrixBase<>& inverseJacobian ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the inverse or the corresponding pseudoinverse of the Jacobian matrix from the given joint position.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isInverseJacobianImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointPosition   The current position of the manipulator.
inverseJacobian   The corresponding inverse Jacobian matrix.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

void inverseJacobianTranspose ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
MatrixBase<>& inverseJacobianTranspose ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the inverse or the corresponding pseudoinverse of the transpose of the Jacobian matrix.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isInverseJacobianImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointPosition   The current position of the manipulator.
inverseJacobianTranspose   The corresponding inverse Jacobian transpose matrix.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, Puma560Model, and WAMModel.

void dynamics ( const VectorBase<>& controlInput,
const VectorBase<>& positionInput,
const VectorBase<>& velocityInput,
VectorBase<>& accelerationOutput,
double samplingFrequency ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the dynamics of the manipulator in closed form: 

     qdotdot = M^-1 * { u - Vm(q,qdot)qdot - friction - gravity }

Note: The class Integrator can be used to integrate the returned acceleration to obtain the manipulator velocity and position.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isDynamicsImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
controlInput   Control input applied to the joints (u)
positionInput   Current joint position of the manipulator (q)
velocityInput   Current velocities of each joint (qdot)
accelerationOutput   The calculated acceleration vector (acc).
samplingTime   The sampling time.

Reimplemented in Puma560Model.

void gravity ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition,
VectorBase<>& gravityVector ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the effect that gravity exerts on each joint.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isGravityImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointPosition   The current position of the manipulator.
gravityVector   The gravity vector. Each element of this vector is set to a value that represents the torque on this joint (revolute joint) or the force on this joint (prismatic joint).

Reimplemented in Puma560Model.

void friction ( const VectorBase<>& jointVelocity,
VectorBase<>& frictionVector ) [virtual]
 

Calculates the effect that friction causes on each joint.

This class sets d_status to "ERROR", because the function is not implemented in this generic base class. If a derived class implements this function, it must also implement the function isGravityImplemented() to return true.

Parameters:
jointVelocity   The current velocity of the joints (rad/sec).
frictionVector   The friction vector. Each element of this vector is set to a value that represents the torque on this joint (revolute joint) or the force on this joint (prismatic joint).

Reimplemented in Puma560Model.

Member Data Documentation

Status d_status
 

The status of operation. Test this data member to see if an operation was successful.

Example: 

     Puma560Model model;
    
     Transform x = translation(10, -30, 50);
     Vector<7> q;
    
     model.inverseKinematics(x, 0, q);
     if (model.d_status.isStatusOk())
     {
       cout << "Joint position = " << q << endl;
     }
     else
     {
       cout << "An error occurred while calculating the joint position: "
            << model.d_status.getMessageText() << endl;
     }

TypeInfoAbstractT< ManipulatorModel > s_typeInfo [static]
 

The static type info object of the class. Every class derived from RoboticObject must have this static data member and initialize it correctly.

Reimplemented in BarrettArmModel, and WAMModel.
